forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy. Low around 32, with temperatures rising to around 38 overnight. South wind 6 to 12 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Scattered rain showers after 7am. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 41 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
As night shrouds Boston in its gentle embrace, the air carries a brief chill, signaling temperatures hovering around the freezing mark. A cloud-draped sky cloaks the city, adding a layer of mystery to the night, yet hinting at a warmer dawn as the mercury may rise to the mid-30s come morning. With a mild southerly breeze slipping through the streets, it’s a night less suited for outdoor revelry and more for the cozy comfort of home, perhaps with a book or a warm drink in hand.

As Saturday unfurls, expect scattered rain showers to weave through the clouds after dawn, while the day shifts from the cool embrace of the morning to mild temperatures reaching the upper 50s, though they will fall again by afternoon, whispering of a chill that’s not far behind. The southwest wind will pick up, stirring leaves and carrying a freshness that could invigorate the spirit but may also remind you to tighten your scarf. For those venturing out, layers will be your ally; a light waterproof jacket and comfortable shoes will keep you steady as you navigate through the blurred contours of an invite-wrought landscape. Embrace the day’s potential for quiet strolls in the park or an artisanal coffee shop expedition, where the persistent rhythm of life in the city hums a backdrop to your own leisurely pursuits.
